Package logic

Class PlayState

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.PlayState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class PlayState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    in the PlayState everything is saved, that happend in the play already, it is send inbetween the different clientLogic instances.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      PlayState​(Player[] group)
      constructor (default) the attributes are initialized but we want the player(s) to change them during the game.

        public PlayState​(Player[] group)
        constructor (default) the attributes are initialized but we want the player(s) to change them during the game.

      • PlayState

        public PlayState​(Player[] playingGroup,
                 Stack declarerStack,
                 Stack opponentsStack,
                 Card[] skat,
                 Colour trump,
                 int playValue,
                 PlayMode pm,
                 int playNr,
                 int trickNr,
                 boolean auctionPossible,
                 boolean handGame,
                 boolean schneider,
                 boolean schneiderAnnounced,
                 boolean schwarz,
                 boolean schwarzAnnounced,
                 boolean open,
                 int baseValue,
                 Trick currentTrick,
                 Auction auction,
                 boolean announcedKontra,
                 boolean announcedRekontra)
        constructor.
        Parameters:
        playingGroup - array of player in this play
        declarerStack - stack of declarer
        opponentsStack - stack of the opponents
        skat - array of skat cards
        trump - of this play
        playValue - of this play
        pm - playMode of this play
        playNr - number of plays already played
        trickNr - number of tricks already played
        auctionPossible - boolean
        handGame - announced
        schneider - more than 90 points for declarer
        schneiderAnnounced - true or false
        schwarz - 0 points for opponents
        schwarzAnnounced - true or false
        open - true or false
        baseValue - of the play
        currentTrick - instance of trick
        auction - of the play
        announcedKontra - true or false
        announcedRekontra - true or false
